subject: Home & DIY
title: How Video Doorbells Changed Home Security
description: A 60-second lesson on How Video Doorbells Changed Home Security.

hook.text: Ring video doorbells have been credited with a 55% drop in burglaries in some neighborhoods. Visibility deters crime.

buildup.text: Video doorbells pack a camera, motion sensor, mic, and speaker. See and talk to visitors from anywhere on your phone.

discovery.text: Motion zones and AI person detection filter cars, animals, and shadows. You're only alerted when a human approaches.

twist.text: Police in some cities request Ring footage without owners knowing. Neighborhood surveillance raises civil liberty fears.

climax.text: End-to-end encryption on Ring and Nest means only youâ€”not the company or policeâ€”can view your doorbell footage.

punchline.text: Your doorbell sees everything. The question is: who else does?

quiz.question: What privacy concern has been raised about Ring video doorbells?
options: Police could request footage without the owner's knowledge
Hackers can view live feeds through default passwords
The cameras record audio inside the home through walls
